text:

6 
MARTIN 
(Spluttering) Well, hang on, hang on, okay, let’s think about this a moment. 
You’re- you’re making a load of assumptions here. You can’t see inside, 
remember? We have no idea what’s happening up there. 
ARCHIVIST 
You’re right, meaning we have no idea what he’s got planned for us. 
MARTIN 
(Frustrated) Yeah, but that was always going to be the case, wasn’t it? 
[Footsteps as the Archivist backs away] 
MARTIN (CONT’D) 
Wait, where are you going? 
ARCHIVIST 
We shouldn’t have come. 
[Martin pulls the Archivist back] 
MARTIN 
A-oh, yeah, sure! We should just go with one of all those other options that we 
have hidden up our sleeves, yeah? 
ARCHIVIST 
Martin… 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 189 – Peers 
 
7 
MARTIN 
(Growing angry) No, d-d-don’t “Martin” me, okay! We’re here, because it’s 
this or nothing, right? 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
MARTIN 
And we can’t do nothing, right? 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
MARTIN 
Great. So, lead on. 
(Annoyed exhale) 
…John? 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh. Um. 
MARTIN 
Where’s the door. John? How do we get inside this monstrosity? 
ARCHIVIST 
I, uh... Hm. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 189 – Peers 
 
8 
MARTIN 
You don’t know? 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m, I’m not sure. 
(Exasperated sound from Martin) 
MARTIN 
(Whispered) Damn it. (normal) Something’s probably blocking you… 
ARCHIVIST 
Maybe. Maybe The Eye doesn’t actually want me in there. Or, or it’s 
something Jonah Magnus put in place, or... ah. 
MARTIN 
Or? 
ARCHIVIST 
Or… 
(The Archivist sighs) 
MARTIN 
(Sternly) Or? 
ARCHIVIST 
Or maybe I can’t bring myself to look. Maybe I don’t actually want to go inside. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 189 – Peers 
 
9 
MARTIN 
(Harshly) For god’s sake John! 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m sorry! 
MARTIN 
(Suppressed anger) No it’s— 
(More calmy) I get it. It’s fine. Maybe there’s another way in? What’s this thing 
made of anyway, like, like, obsidian or something, right? 
ARCHIVIST 
One-way mirrored glass. 
MARTIN 
Of course it is. Well, if it’s just glass, then it won’t be hard to break, right? We 
can just grab something heavy, like one of these cameras, and then all I need... 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh, I wouldn’t. 
[Martin grabs and there is a fleshy, farty, yet pneumatic-like sound] 
MARTIN 
Oh! Oh! Eurgh… 
(Martin gags) 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 189 – Peers 
 
10 
ARCHIVIST 
(Softly) Warned you. 
MARTIN 
(Raging) Brilliant! Just brilliant! 
[Thick glass is kicked twice, and a can in the firing zone rolls away] 
MARTIN (CONT’D) 
Argh! Damnit! 
ARCHIVIST 
(Quietly) Martin… 
MARTIN 
(Sharp) What? 
ARCHIVIST 
Look, just… just give me... Let me try to focus, tune out all these watchers. I-
I’ve-I’ve got a statement to make anyway. 
MARTIN 
Already? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Tired) Yes. There’s a lot here, Martin. A lot. 
MARTIN 
(Harshly) Fine... fine. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 189 – Peers 
 
11 
(Calmer) I’ll do a lap of the base. See if I can find any way in through any of the 
bits that used to be the Institute. 
ARCHIVIST 
Just be careful, okay? 
MARTIN 
Yeah, alright. Don’t worry about me. 
Besides if anything happens… least there’s plenty of witnesses. 
ARCHIVIST 
That’s not funny. 
MARTIN 
No. 
(Martin sighs) 
Be back soon. 
[Brisk footsteps as Martin walks away] 
[two spotlights ka-chonk on] 
ARCHIVIST 
Right, here’s your bloody performance... 
[Hissing static starts] 
[The Panopticon exterior is replaced with the urban sounds of a 
distant car alarm, helicopters and traffic; camera iris movements 
are also heard]
